# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Certainly. Below is the `clean_column` function written in Julia that performs the required operations on the input column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end
```

This function will take a string `col`, strip leading and trailing whitespace, convert all characters to lowercase, and replace any whitespace or hyphen with underscores.
